definition.S: Cloud computing is the delivery of computing services over the internet.
Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) provides virtualized computing resources over the internet.
Platform as a Service (PaaS) allows customers to develop, run, and manage applications without dealing with infrastructure.
Software as a Service (SaaS) delivers software applications over the internet on a subscription basis.
Public cloud is a cloud computing model where services are shared across multiple organizations.
Private cloud is a cloud computing model dedicated to a single organization, enhancing security and control.
Hybrid cloud combines public and private clouds, allowing data and applications to be shared between them.
Multi-cloud refers to the use of multiple cloud computing services from different providers in a single architecture.
Cloud storage enables data to be stored on remote servers accessed via the internet.
Virtual Machine (VM) is a software emulation of physical computers that allows multiple OS instances to run on a single machine.
Containerization encapsulates an application and its dependencies into a single unit called a container.
Microservices is an architectural style that structures an application as a collection of small, independent services.
Serverless computing allows developers to build and run applications without managing servers.
DevOps is a set of practices that combines software development (Dev) and IT operations (Ops) for improved collaboration.
Cloud-native applications are designed to leverage cloud computing architectures and services.
Cloud orchestration automates the management of complex cloud services and workflows.
Cloud migration is the process of moving data, applications, and workloads to a cloud environment.
API (Application Programming Interface) allows applications to communicate with each other over the internet.
Data center is a facility used to house computer systems and associated components, such as telecommunications and storage.
Edge computing processes data closer to the source to reduce latency and bandwidth usage.
Load balancing distributes incoming network traffic across multiple servers to ensure reliability and performance.
Cloud security encompasses the technologies, policies, and controls that protect data, applications, and infrastructure.
Backup as a Service (BaaS) provides data backup and recovery solutions over the cloud.
Disaster Recovery as a Service (DRaaS) provides backup resources and failover to protect against data loss.
